snippet: After family members said they had found the bodies of three more men detained by American forces, Afghan soldiers opened fire on their protest.
abstract: Afghan Army troops open fire on unruly protest by family members of 17 Afghan men detained by American Special Forces team in Wardak province, killing one person and critically wounding another; shooting comes after family members find what they believe are bodies of last three people missing.

byline.original: By SANGAR RAHIMI and ROD NORDLAND
byline.contributor: Sangar Rahimi reported from Kabul, and Rod Nordland from London. Azam Ahmed contributed reporting from Kabul.

lead_paragraph: After family members said they had found the bodies of three more men detained by American forces, Afghan soldiers opened fire on their protest.

headline.seo: Afghans Say New Bodies Are Found Near Former U.S. Base
headline.main: Afghans Say New Bodies Have Been Found Near a Former U.S. Base
headline.print_headline: Afghans Say New Bodies Have Been Found Near a Former U.S. Base

keywords.value: United States Defense and Military Forces
